title: What to do if someone calls out of hours and you're not sure if they are covered
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS If it IS a P1 If it's NOT a P1 What if they don't have cover? If you discover that the call is from a company who does not have cover If they insist they do have cover, and Freshdesk says not Exception for the UK Support Team Companies have the option to purchase support cover in the Evenings, Saturdays, Sundays/Public Holidays (one, all, or any combination of those 3 options). We do not offer out of hours support for some products like Cowis. If they do pay for this cover, it's only for P1s (unable to trade at a location/site/store) as per the Global Standard SLA. If it IS a P1 Either: Ask them to wait while you verify their details. You can then quickly look up their cover on the Company record. OR Log a ticket with the details of the issue and say you will investigate once you have verified their cover (then look up the cover after the call). If it's NOT a P1 Please politely tell them that the out of hours hotline is only for P1/can't trade issues (the hotline is actually always meant to be for only P1 issues!), and ask them to log their ticket via the portal (or email) and someone will look at it during normal Monday-Friday business days/hours. You can use your judgement on this, so for example, if this is a VIP customer with a P2, or any customer who has a till down, and there are not many other tills, then although it's a P2, it's fine to work on it as long as there are no P1s you should be working on first. What if they don't have cover? If you discover that the call is from a company who does not have cover You will need to call them back (if you've not still on the phone to them) and explain that they don't have the appropriate cover, and ask who we should contact at the company if they want a CSM to send them a quote for subscribing to out of hours cover. If they insist they do have cover, and Freshdesk says not You will have to tell the customer that you will help now because you can't verify with the CSM or Accounts team until the next working day, but if they don't have cover, they will be charged for the cost of helping them (which means they will have to sign up to the annual out of hours cover, or pay a high one-off fee with no further out of hours help). Exception for the UK Support Team The UK team are paid to be working full time out of hours, not just being on standby/reacting to P1s (which is the arrangement for the DK and NL teams). This means that the UK team should work on any other tickets during the out of hours shift, but priority should always be given to customers who are paying for out of hours cover who have a P1 (or exceptional P2). Therefore if a customer ever says in an evening or weekend/PH shift "why won't you work on my P3 ticket I've raised today", you can say that they are only paying for P1s to be worked on out of hours, but if there are no P1s, then we may work on other tickets in order of when their resolution is due in accordance with the SLA.

title: Shifts in Teams - User Guide
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Start using - Shifts in Teams How to open the Shifts app How to get a useful overview in Shifts Suggested Settings Shifts on your phone Requests Swap a shift Offer a shift Approve, Deny or Cancel request Introduction The rationale for using the Shifts App via Teams is to simplify the workflow across the organization's countries – UK,NL,DE,DK. With Shifts in Teams, we introduce the concept of "SPOV" - SINGLE POINT OF VIEW. One Place where employees and managers can get an overview 24/7. Note that Shifts is also available on mobile devices with excellent overview. Start using - Shifts in Teams How to open the Shifts app You'll find Shifts on the left side of Teams with the other apps. Select it to start viewing your schedule. If you don’t see it there, select the “View More apps” ... button and find it in the list. Make sure to choose the correct team for you - Retail Solutions.Customer Support How to get a useful overview in Shifts In the menu it is possible to select how to view the shifts. You have the options of Day, Week and Month - Try using Week for starters. There is also a Filter function. Using “All Active” shows you who has a duty shifts. In the same menu you can choose Groups This shows you the selected country - DE, DK, UK and NL In the same menu you can choose Groups This shows you the selected country - DE, DK, UK and NL Last option In the menu bar there is a view function. Depending on your needs you can choose the desired view. Suggested Settings Below you can see an example of the best view in Shifts Selected - Week Selected - All Active and country Selected - View Team Shifts Shifts on your phone The mobile app is geared for the frontline worker. See your upcoming shifts with the tap of a finger! To access Shifts on your mobile device, open Teams and navigate down to the right corner. Open the menu represented by ... Here you can open the Shifts app and choose your team, Requests Team Members can Request time off, Shift Swaps and Offer their Shifts to other Team Members. These need to be Approved and then shared. All Requests are made by selecting the Requests tab at the top of the Schedule. Swap a shift Used to swap a shift with another team members shift. You start by choosing the "New request" button. Then you select the "Swap" tab. Select the date and shift you want to swap with a team member. Select the Shift to Swap to. Add a note if necessary then select "Send request" Offer a shift Used to offer your shift to another team member. You start by choosing the "New request" button. Select the Offer tab Select the date and the Shift to be Swapped and the Member to Offer it to. Add a note if necessary then select "Send request" Approve, Deny or Cancel request Requests are divided into two sections, In Progress and Completed In the In Progress section, select the relevant Request. Choose Deny or Approve, adding a note if necessary. Once actioned, the Request moves to the Completed section. A Shift Swap or Offer will require approval from the other Team Member.

Introduction


The rationale for using the Shifts App via Teams is to simplify the workflow across the organization's countries – UK,NL,DE,DK.

 

With Shifts in Teams, we introduce the concept of "SPOV" - SINGLE POINT OF VIEW.

 

One Place where employees and managers can get an overview 24/7.

 

Note that Shifts is also available on mobile devices with excellent overview.



Start using - Shifts in Teams


How to open the Shifts app

 

You'll find Shifts on the left side of Teams with the other apps. Select it to start viewing your schedule. If you don’t see it there, select the “View More apps” ... button and find it in the list.

 

Make sure to choose the correct team for you - Retail Solutions.Customer Support

 

 

How to get a useful overview in Shifts


In the menu it is possible to select how to view the shifts.
You have the options of Day, Week and Month 

- Try using Week for starters.


There is also a Filter function.

Using “All Active” shows you who has a duty shifts.

 

In the same menu you can choose Groups

This shows you the selected country - DE, DK, UK and NL  



In the same menu you can choose Groups

This shows you the selected country - DE, DK, UK and NL  


Last option In the menu bar there is a view function. Depending on your needs you can choose the desired view.

Suggested Settings


Below you can see an example of the best view in Shifts

 

  • Selected - Week
  • Selected - All Active and country
  • Selected - View Team Shifts



Shifts on your phone



The mobile app is geared for the frontline worker.
See your upcoming shifts with the tap of a finger!

To access Shifts on your mobile device,
open Teams and navigate down to the right corner.
Open the menu represented by ... 

Here you can open the Shifts app and choose your team,

Requests

Team Members can Request time off, Shift Swaps and Offer their Shifts to other Team Members. These need to be Approved and then shared.


All Requests are made by selecting the Requests tab at the top of the Schedule.



Swap a shift


Used to swap a shift with another team members shift.

You start by choosing the "New request" button.
Then you select the "Swap" tab.
Select the date and shift you want to swap with a team member.
Select the Shift to Swap to.

Add a note if necessary then select "Send request" 


Offer a shift


Used to offer your shift to another team member.

You start by choosing the "New request" button.
Select the Offer tab
Select the date and the Shift to be Swapped and the Member to Offer it to.

Add a note if necessary then select "Send request"



Approve, Deny or Cancel request


Requests are divided into two sections, In Progress and Completed


In the In Progress section, select the relevant Request.
Choose Deny or Approve, adding a note if necessary.

Once actioned, the Request moves to the Completed section.
A Shift Swap or Offer will require approval from the other Team Member.

title: Shifts in Teams - Admin Guide
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Creating shifts Manual shift Manual open shift Create shifts from excel import Share schedule with team Exporting information Approve or Deny request Creating shifts Creating shifts can be done in 2 ways, manually and by uploading an excel sheet that can contain several employees. Manual shift This will create and allocate the shift to the specified employee. Double click an empty slot within the Member’s Schedule This open the shift properties. Here you can change the properties of the specific shift. When everything is entered and the Shift is ready for allocation, select "Save" The Shift is now allocated. Manual open shift An Open Shift is a Shift that is on Offer to all Members of that Group. Double click the Open Shift field for the day on Offer. The Shift Properties open with the Open Shift toggle on. When everything is entered and the Shift is ready to be Offered, select "Save". The Shift is now Open for Members of the specified team to Request. *Remember to share the changes with the team. Create shifts from excel import Start by filling out the excel template file. Columns marked with Bold needs to be filled out or you will get an error. If member column is left blank it will make an open shift. Here is an example: To upload the shifts file you open the menu marked with ... Here you choose "import schedule" and follow the on screen prompt. *Remember to share the changes with the team. Share schedule with team Once all Shifts have been set up, the Schedule needs to be shared with the Team. Shifts will not be ‘live’ until sharing has been completed. An asterisk indicates that there is new information or information has changed and is yet to be shared with the Team. When you have checked everything is correct press Select the Date Range to be shared and who will be notified then select "Share". Once the Schedule has been shared, the Share with Team button will be inactive (greyed out). The Schedule is now shared and the appearance of the Shifts changes, removing the asterisk. Exporting information To export shift/hour information from teams to excel, you open the menu marked with ... Here you choose "Export schedule". Here you choose the date range you want to export and then press "Export" The file will now be downloaded to your specified download folder in windows. Below you can the an example of the extract (First tab - Schedule) Below you can the an example of the extract (Second tab - Totals). This will give you an complete report of how many hours have been registered. Approve or Deny request Requests are divided into two sections, In Progress and Completed In the In Progress section, select the relevant Request. Choose Deny or Approve, adding a note if necessary. Once actioned, the Request moves to the Completed section.

title: UK out of hours standby, callout, and overtime claims
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Overview Standby and Callout Standby (sometimes known as being "on-call") Callout (effectively the same as doing Overtime) Overtime Overview This article applies to the UK Retail Solutions team only because other countries have different schemes in place. Standby and Callout is for when you are available to be called for an emergency situation, and then claim for time spent dealing with that emergency. Overtime is for when your manager has approved for you to work more hours than your contracted standard working hours per day i.e. actively working, not being on standby for possibly working if called out Standby and Callout Standby (sometimes known as being "on-call") If on standby, you need to answer any phone calls made to you (which might be from another K3 team, or from a customer), and respond to any emergency Teams messages To be on Standby, you are entitled to have a company mobile phone allowance Team members do not need to be logged onto their computer unless they receive a phone call from FLS. You need to be able to logon to your laptop to deal with the issue within 15 minutes of a confirmed emergency call. You will be paid a fixed fee for standby availability (as of 2025, £10 per hour except £15/hour on Public Holidays). Hours claimed for standby should exclude your lunchbreak, and exclude any time you spend dealing with an emergency call which is claimed for separately. In the event that you are called by a customer, and it's not an emergency, you should ask the customer to log the details via email or portal, and explain that it will be dealt with the next working day. It is not expected that you will claim callout for this, but if it happens on a regular basis, then this can be reviewed. The number of people, days and times that you're on Standby can vary by team, and may change according to customer and business requirements. See Callout (effectively the same as doing Overtime) Callout work will be paid at 1.5x your normal hourly rate (or 2x on Public Holidays). These are the same rates as as Overtime You will need to keep a careful record of the time you spend on a confirmed emergency incident. Standby hours will not be claimed for the same period of time as claiming callout hours, ensuring no double payment. Team members must be able to work on the issue within 15 minutes of being called. Overtime Overtime is paid for active working outside of your normal hours (as opposed to standby which is being available for, but not actively working). Overtime must be pre-approved by your manager (e.g. time for fixes/upgrades that can't be done in trading hours). Email approval from your manager is best (or Teams message if it's really last-minute urgent). Occasionally it may not be possible to gain approval in advance which will be treated as an exception and the circumstances discussed with your manager. The MStore team are pre-approved to be paid overtime when they are on shift to: Work weekends and public holidays - the person on duty is paid to be working all day on tasks of all types and priorities (same as they would on a normal business hours working day) Regardless of their normal first or second line role, the person on duty should triage any new MStore tickets and respond to P1s as top priority in accordance to the customers paying for Extended Hours support. If a ticket is confirmed as a P1 hardware ticket, they should call one of the hardware team who are on standby during Extended Hours Overtime will be paid at 1.5x your normal hourly rate (or 2x on Public Holidays).
